catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 828
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: flower vase with squat, round body, high neck, and high foot; ornately decorated with figures in relief; figure of a sage and a crane on each side of neck; two handles
text: Lionized poets from Chinese antiquity, such as the famous Song dynasty recluse-poet Lin Hejing (also Lin Bu; 967–1028), were a popular motif in Japanese painting and decorative arts, beginning in the medieval period. Lin Hejing is said to have lived a solitary life with only a crane to keep him company. Here, the poet and his crane cling to either side of the neck of this bronze vase.
title: Vase with Rin Nasei (Ch. Lin Hejing) and crane
